00001 // This is your first RL application. You shouldn't need to edit this
00002 // file until you have MySimulator.cc and MySimlator.hh complete and
00003 // the code compiles and runs. Then you should consider modifying this
00004 // file for best performance and using alternative algorithms. 
00005 
00006 // The first thing to consider changing is the algorithm used. This
00007 // file defaults to Natural Actor-Critic. You can also switch to
00008 // Least Squares Policy Iteration. These are both state of the art
00009 // algorithms in RL. See documentation for other altgorithms and
00010 // advanced things to do with TransformControllers.
00011 
00012 // The next thing you can do is twiddle the values of the #defines
00013 // for better performance. Note that this code also shows how to
00014 // save parameter files so that you can recover your optimised
00015 // policy.
00016 
00017 #include"PGBasics.hh"
00018 
00019 // Your simulator
00020 #include"MySimulator.hh"
00021 
00022 // Approximators
00023 #include"NeuralNetBatch.hh"
00024 #include"LookupTableBatch.hh" // Use for exact MDPs
00025 
00026 // Controllers
00027 #include"BasicController.hh"
00028 #include"NACTransform.hh"
00029 #include"eGreedyPolicy.hh"
00030 #include"LSTDQController.hh"
00031 
00032 // RLAlg
00033 #include"OLPomdp.hh"
00034 
00035 /**********************************************************
00036  * Hard coded settings you can change
00037  **********************************************************/
00038 
00039 #define NAC 0
00040 #define LSPI 1
00041 #define ALGORITHM NAC // 0 for Natural actor critic, 1 for LSPI
00042                       // If you change this, change LAMBDA below.
00043 
00044 #define MAX_STEPS 0 // Total max optimisation steps, 0=unbounded
00045 #define MAX_TIME 0 // Total max wall clock time, 0=unbounded
00046 #define EPOCH_STEPS 1000 // Steps per epoch (progress print outs/LSTDQ steps)
00047                          // Increase this if youre getting too much information.
00048                          // Decrease this if things are very slow, but not
00049                          // too small for LSPI otherwise it will
00050                          // increase variance.
00051                        
00052 
00053 // Location of parameter save file
00054 #define PARAMETER_FILE "parameters.txt"
00055 
00056 #define LAMBDA 0.8 // For NAC, start with 0.8. Always stay less than
00057                    // 1.0 Increase slowly only if you're not getting a
00058                    // good solution. If you're getting no improvement
00059                    // at all start by increasing the step size below.
00060                    // For LSPI, start with 0.0 and try values up to an
00061                    // including 1.0
00062 
00063 // LSPI Specific settings
00064 #define EXPLORATION_PROB 0.1 // Probability of a random action
00065 
00066 // Natural actor-critic specific settings
00067 #define STEP_SIZE 0.00001 // Start small and grow by 10x until things
00068                           // become unstable during optimisation. If
00069                           // nothing at all seems to change, this value
00070                           // might need to be much bigger.
00071                           // If things improve quickly at the start, then
00072                           // the reward suddenly gets much worse, make
00073                           // this smaller.
00074 
00075 
00076 
00077 
00078 using namespace std;
00079 using namespace libpg;
00080 
00081 
00082 RLAlg* createRLAlg() {
00083     
00084     // STEP 1. Create simulator
00085     // [WRITE CODE HERE] Insert parameters into constructor if needed.
00086     MySimulator* mySimulator = new MySimulator();
00087 
00088     // STEP 2. Create linear approximator (see documentation to change this to a multi-layer perceptron)
00089     Approximator* neuralNet = new NeuralNetBatch(mySimulator->getObsRows(), mySimulator->getNumActions());
00090     
00091     // STEP 3. Create a controller (implement different algorithms here)
00092     Controller* controller;
00093     if (ALGORITHM == NAC) {
00094       // Create Natural Actor-Critic controller
00095       controller = new NACTransform(new BasicController(neuralNet), mySimulator->getDiscountFactor());  
00096     }
00097     else {
00098       // Create alternative LSPI controller
00099       controller = new LSTDQController(neuralNet, 
00100                                        new eGreedyPolicy(EXPLORATION_PROB),
00101                                        mySimulator->getDiscountFactor());
00102     }
00103       
00104     // STEP 4. Link all together with an algorithm
00105     RLAlg* alg = new OLPomdp(controller, mySimulator, LAMBDA, STEP_SIZE);
00106 
00107     return alg;
00108 
00109 }
00110 
00111 
00112 void optimise() {
00113 
00114     RLAlg* alg = createRLAlg();
00115 
00116     // Indicate to automatically save the parameters whenever performance improves
00117     alg->saveBest(PARAMETER_FILE);
00118 
00119     // STEP 5. Learn!
00120     alg->learn(EPOCH_STEPS, MAX_TIME, MAX_STEPS);
00121 
00122     // Will exit when MAX_TIME or MAX_STEPS is exceeded.
00123 }
00124 
00125 
00126 void evaluate(char* oldParametersFile) {
00127 
00128     RLAlg* alg = createRLAlg();
00129     
00130     alg->read(oldParametersFile);
00131     alg->evaluateAndPrint(EPOCH_STEPS, MAX_STEPS);
00132 
00133     // Will return when MAX_STEPS is reached
00134 
00135 }
00136 
00137 
00141 int main(int argc, char** argv) {
00142 
00143     if (argc == 1) {
00144         // No command line parameters. Do optimisation
00145         optimise();
00146     }
00147     else {
00148         // Evaluate a previous set of saved parameters
00149         evaluate(argv[1]);
00150     }
00151 
00152     exit(EXIT_SUCCESS);
00153 
00154 }
